Peace Corps in Benin

Volunteers in Benin work with their communities on projects in community economic development, education, the environment, and health. During their service in Benin, Volunteers learn to speak local languages, including Bariba, Ditamari, Dendi, Fon, French, Mahi, and Nagot.

Volunteers
Current: 111
To Date: 2163
Program Dates
1968-present
Official Language
French

Volunteer Openings in Benin

View all
There are currently no Peace Corps Volunteer openings in Benin.

Looking back on my Peace Corps service, I know I’ll remember not the number of trees planted or mud stoves built, but the personal connections made, the moments of simple joy that life in Africa accords, and the challenges that shaped me into being a stronger person. That will stay with me forever.

Diane Albrechtm, Volunteer in Benin.

Current Projects in Benin

Agriculture Education Health Let Girls Learn President's Malaria Initiative

Peace Corps in Botswana

Volunteers in Botswana work with their communities on projects in youth development and health. During their service in Botswana, Volunteers learn to speak local languages, including Setswana, Ikalanga, and Kgalagadi.

Volunteers
Current: 159
To Date: 2688
Program Dates
1966-1997; 2003-present
Official Language
Setswana, English

Volunteer Openings in Botswana

View all
There are currently no Peace Corps Volunteer openings in Botswana.

I found purpose in each day as a Peace Corps Botswana Volunteer. Looking back, some of the most difficult moments turned out to be the most educational and rewarding times and shaped who I am today. I found true happiness throughout my time in Botswana.

Nate G., Returned Peace Corps Volunteer

Health Education President's Emergency Plan for AIDS Relief

Peace Corps in Burkina Faso

The Peace Corps suspended its Volunteer activities in Burkina Faso in September 2017. Volunteers worked with their communities on projects in community economic development, education, and health. They also learned to speak local languages, including Bissa, Dagara, French, Jula, Lyele, Lobiri, and Mooré.

Volunteers
Current: N/A
To Date: 2155
Program Dates
1967-1987, 1995-present
Official Language
French

Volunteer Openings in Burkina Faso

View all
There are currently no Peace Corps Volunteer openings in Burkina Faso.

Challenge yourself, empower others.

Nadim Houssain, Burkina Faso Peace Corps Volunteer, 2013-2015

Peace Corps in Cameroon

Volunteers in Cameroon work with their communities on projects in agriculture, education, and health. During their service in Cameroon, Volunteers learn to speak local languages, including French, Fulfuldé, and Pidgin English.

Volunteers
Current: 146
To Date: 3755
Program Dates
1962-present
Official Language
French, English

Volunteer Openings in Cameroon

View all
There are currently no Peace Corps Volunteer openings in Cameroon.

Over the years, the Peace Corps and its Volunteers have strengthened my entrepreneurial and leadership capabilities and taught me how to make an impact in my community. I learned to solve problems in my hometown by valuing local resources.

Gabriel, Peace Corps Volunteer Counterpart

Kenya

Peace Corps in Kenya

The Peace Corps suspended its Volunteer activities in Kenya in July 2014. More than 5,155 Peace Corps Volunteers have served in Kenya since the program was established in 1964. Working in the areas of education, health, and community economic development during their service, Volunteers learned to speak the local languages, including Kiswahili, Kenyan Sign Language, Kalenjin, Kikuyu, Luo, and Luyha.

Volunteers
Current: N/A
To Date: 5155
Program Dates
1964-present
Official Language
English, Kiswahili

Volunteer Openings in Indonesia

View all
There are currently no Peace Corps Volunteer openings in Indonesia.

As a volunteer and a foreigner who looks different from everyone else, I was often put on the spot or led into awkward situations and encounters with people. From having so many of these experiences, I learned how to cope with and make the best out of these situations. Being in Peace Corps taught me how to become more sensitive and cognizant of others around me, to think from their perspectives, and that I can easily make an awkward situation more enjoyable by having a good attitude going into it.

Elle Chang, Indonesia Volunteer (2011-13)

With enthusiasm, dedication, creativity, respect, resilience, perseverance, and professionalism, we aspire to make a real difference in the lives of the Costa Rican children, youth, and families who face daily hardships and are seeking a new future. Peace Corps in Morocco

Volunteers in Morocco work with their communities on youth development projects. During their service in Morocco, Volunteers learn to speak Moroccan Arabic (Darija). Some Volunteers also learn to speak local languages, including Tachelhit or Tamzight. 

Volunteers
Current: 206
To Date: 5052
Program Dates
1963-present
Official Language
Arabic, Berber

Volunteer Openings in Morocco

View all
There are currently no Peace Corps Volunteer openings in Morocco.

This year the United States Peace Corps celebrates 55 years of service to the people of Morocco. The 100th group of volunteers arrive to the Kingdom in September, 2018. These milestones are a testament to the strong friendship and partnership between the people and government of the Kingdom of Morocco and the United States Peace Corps.

Susan M. Dwyer, Country Director

Peace Corps in the Federated States of Micronesia and Republic of Palau

Volunteers in Micronesia work with their communities on projects in education, health, youth development, and community economic development. During their service, Volunteers learn to speak local languages, including Chuukese, Kosraean, Mortlockese, Pohnpeian, and Yapese. 

Volunteers
Current: 26
To Date: 4394
Program Dates
1966-present
Official Language
English, Palauan

Volunteer Openings in Micronesia

View all
There are currently no Peace Corps Volunteer openings in Micronesia.

I can think of no people as warm, welcoming, and wonderful as the people of Micronesia. The entire region--Palau, Yap, Chuuk, Pohnpei, Kosrae--is a marriage of humanity's best values (the importance of family, respect for others, cooperation over competition) juxtaposed with a natural environment equally grand in both biological diversity and heart-stopping beauty. If America incorporated some Micronesian thinking into its own cultural and political processes, I have no doubt we'd have a gentler, more representative republic.

Richard Clark, Volunteer in Micronesia, 2013-2016

Community Economic Development Education Let Girls Learn

Peace Corps in Samoa

Volunteers in Samoa work with their communities on education projects. During their service in Samoa, Volunteers learn to speak Samoan. 

Volunteers
Current: 56
To Date: 1876
Program Dates
1967-present
Official Language
Samoan, English

Volunteer Openings in Samoa

View all
There are currently no Peace Corps Volunteer openings in Samoa.

Things will be difficult and sometimes they will be so difficult that you’ll just want to give up, but nothing is impossible. They say that Polynesian people are some of the happiest people in the world and I have discovered, even on the hardest days here that this “Samoan happiness” is truly infectious. In Samoa you will surprise yourself. You will face your share of obstacles but throughout the course of this wonderfully crazy adventure, you will realize that you are a lot stronger than you ever thought you were.

Kate Brolley, Volunteer

Official Language
English

Peace Corps in Paraguay

Volunteers in Paraguay work with their communities on projects in agriculture, community economic development, the environment, and health. During their service in Paraguay, Volunteers learn to speak local languages, including Guaraní and Spanish. 

Volunteers

To Date: 4173
Program Dates
1966-present
Official Language
Spanish, Guaraní
